title: Geth stuck on block 15090000 - BAD BLOCK - Latest Version 1.10.20
body:
This is a repost of #25260 because it was closed incorrectly. This issue exists on the latest version of geth, at least on my setup.

#### System information

Geth version: `geth version`
```
Geth
Version: 1.10.20-stable
Architecture: arm64
Go Version: go1.18.3
Operating System: darwin
GOPATH=
GOROOT=go
```
OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
```
macOS 12.4
```
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour

Able to process blocks

#### Actual behaviour

Keep getting `BAD BLOCK` at block number `15090000`

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Run geth

According to etherscan, this block is valid. My hunch is your ethash cache file is fired, so it generates an invalid digest.

You can delete the ethash DAG(`/Volumes/ethdrive/ethash`), it should be regenerated in the next restart.
@rjl493456442 thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! idk how it got corrupted but that did it, we're back. thanks so much!!!
